title: Uuuh ohhhh
body:
So basically, my friend here sent me a link for this random free Akali skin. I was like, "k kool let me test it out". So basically, because it's late right now and Im so tired, I clicked it, logged in, entered some of my acc details, and basically..... the website knows my acc details :D

Being the idiot I am, I copied the "code" and tried to access it. Then it hit me. I realised that the website was a www league of legends .com webiste. It was from 2014. 

Soooooooo basically are they able to access my acc? Just changed my password. Friend logged immediately off.

I'm smart.

replies.body:
If you had card details saved on your account, make like Kaboomblah recommends and cancel that card quick (or at least freeze it, whatever you can).

Changing your password should be enough to prevent them from accessing your account again, but I'd also recommend changing any passwords you have that are the same and changing the password for the email attached to the account as well.

If you so much as suspect someone still has access to your account change the password again and submit an account recovery ticket to player support (https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

I'd also recommend submitting a ticket with the summ name of the friend that sent you the link, more than likely that account has been compromised and will need to be recovered.

Dude, hurry the phuck up about this.

Log into your Netbank account via mobile app or internet banking and disable your card.

Then go into the bank on Monday, cancel that card, and ask for a new one.

Don't repeat what you did.

EDIT: Try calling the bank now.
